item.title: Hell's Revenge 4x4 Off-Roading Tour from Moab
item.description: Roam over the sandstone domes and slickrock ledges of Hell's Revenge near Moab on this off-road adventure by utility terrain vehicle. Hop aboard your Kawasaki Teryx 4, opting to drive or join as a passenger. Then, navigate the dramatic terrain, full of steep climbs and descents. You’re treated to views of the La Sal Mountains, the Colorado River and the sandstone cliffs of Echo Canyon.

image.alt: Hell's Revenge 4x4 Off-Roading Tour from Moab

item.title: Arches National Park 4x4 Adventure from Moab
item.description: To truly experience the legendary beauty of Arches National Park, you need to explore its isolated corners. On this adventurous 4WD tour from Moab, your expert guide will help you do just that as you navigate the backcountry to spots like the Tower Arch, as well as visit the famous red rocks at Marching Men and Eye of the Whale. Bonus: Your tour features a stop to see fossilized dinosaur tracks.

image.alt: Arches National Park 4x4 Adventure from Moab

item.title: Canyonlands National Park Half-Day Tour from Moab
item.description: On this half-day 4WD adventure from Moab, explore the rugged, red stone interior of Canyonlands National Park, where you’ll experience the beauty of the Island in the Sky district and the stunning Gooseneck Overlook. Your professional guide will navigate your vehicle down the switchbacks of White Rim Road, where you will not only see the remains of ancient Pueblo civilizations, but also admire the canyon walls that drop 1,000 feet (300m) down. It’s an easy drive from Moab to Canyonlands, and the views of the meandering Colorado River help cap off this Utah adventure.

image.alt: Canyonlands National Park Half-Day Tour from Moab

item.title: You-Drive Tour: 4X4 Experience at Hell's Revenge with Fins&Things
item.description: Take an adventurous ride into the sunset on a UTV (similar to an ATV) on the Hell's Revenge Trail. You’ll pass petrified sand dunes and get the chance to take in great views of the surrounding canyons and rock formations as you zip over rough and slick terrains. Best of all, you'll get to experience the thrill of driving yourself.

image.alt: You-Drive Tour: 4X4 Experience at Hell's Revenge with Fins&Things

item.title: Moab's Most Xtreme 3-Hour Experience on Hell's Revenge
item.description: Adventure-seeking travelers will love this three-hour extreme experience. You'll venture along some of the most rugged trails in the Moab Desert in a tough ATV with a roll cage, five-point harnesses, and bucket seats. You'll be safe and secure while enjoying the thrilling ride through rocky canyons, along cliff tops, up steep hills, and past some of the most amazing desert features.

image.alt: Moab's Most Xtreme 3-Hour Experience on Hell's Revenge

item.title: 2.5 Hour U-Drive-Guided Hell's Revenge UTV Tour
item.description: Experience Utah’s thrilling Hell’s Revenge Trail on a UTV with this excursion. Join a small group and traverse steep climbs and slick rock as you head to your destination—the Colorado River Overlook. From the top, gaze over at Arches National Park and the surrounding desert before heading back to the starting point.

image.alt: 2.5 Hour U-Drive-Guided Hell's Revenge UTV Tour

item.title: Thrilling Guided You-Drive Hells Revenge UTV Tour In Moab UT
item.description: Enjoy an intrepid, one-of-a-kind excursion through Moab’s dramatic scenery and Slickrock Trail on this guided all-terrain vehicle tour. Pick between multiple convenient tour times, and make your own way to the departure point in central Moab. Once you get acquainted with your ATV and your gear, follow your guide up steep inclines, big descents, and keep one eye on the striking landscapes as you go.

image.alt: Thrilling Guided You-Drive Hells Revenge UTV Tour In Moab UT

item.title: Arches National Park Back Country Adventure from Moab
item.description: The tour will head north on US 191 passing the entrance of Arches National Park which was designated as a National Monument before being changed to a National Park in 1971. Our special use permit allows us to enter the back door to Arches via Willow Springs Road. Along this backcountry route, you'll travel through the new area of the "Utah Raptor State Park". Here where Native Americans lived back in history for thousands of years you'll see dinosaur tracks and enjoy the views of the La Sal Mountains. The Park lies atop an underground salt bed that is responsible for the arches, spires, and sandstone fins. Several of the stops include Eye of the Whale(Backcountry), Balanced Rock(Pavement), Sand Dune Arch(Pavement), Delicate Arche Viewpoint(Pavement), and the Windows Section(Pavement). The trip length is approximately 4 hours duration. All vehicles are Jeep Rubicons which are enclosed and air-conditioned.

image.alt: Arches National Park Back Country Adventure from Moab

item.title: Moab Rafting Afternoon Half-Day Trip
item.description: Get a taste of what eastern Utah has to offer and spend your afternoon rafting down the Colorado River in the Moab area on this exciting excursion. Take in the desert landscapes as you navigate rapids and paddle through red rock canyons, Castle Valley, and Fisher Towers. After a few hours on the water, feel rejuvenated and excited to explore the rest of Moab.

image.alt: Moab Rafting Afternoon Half-Day Trip

item.title: Moab Private Half-Day Canyoneering (4 Hours)
item.description: Immerse yourself in the dramatic canyons and landscapes of southern Utah—and enjoy an accessible, beginner-friendly introduction to canyoneering—on this private, half-day tour. Meet your guide in the morning directly at your area hotel, hop aboard your private vehicle, and head into nature. After a safety briefing and introduction, grab your gear, get active, and explore the heart of canyon country.

image.alt: Moab Private Half-Day Canyoneering (4 Hours)

item.title: Moab Rafting Morning Half-Day Trip
item.description: Explore Moab's desert beauty with your family while splashing your way down Class II rapids on the mighty Colorado. Take in the scenic red rock landscape while your raft guide points out the fascinating natural history of the area that makes it unforgettable. There's no better way to appreciate this terrain than by floating down the river that carved it.

image.alt: Moab Rafting Morning Half-Day Trip

item.title: Canyonlands National Park Backcountry 4x4 Adventure from Moab
item.description: Discover the rugged beauty and ancient legends of Canyonlands National Park on a 4WD tour from Moab. Go off-roading in a sturdy Jeep to reach the Island in the Sky district and other remote areas, where the Colorado River slices through steep ravines and ancient Pueblo rock art decorates the sandstone cliffs. Hold on tight as your driver and guide navigates the switchbacks of Shafer Trail, and fill your camera roll with amazing perspective shots of the red-rock canyons.

image.alt: Canyonlands National Park Backcountry 4x4 Adventure from Moab

item.title: Self Guided Backcountry Jeep Adventure
item.description: Moab's red rock scenery is one of the most impressive but exploring it with a group can hold you back if there's certain things you want to do. This Moab Backcountry Jeep Adventure lets you take a Jeep out on your own so you can explore at your own pace. Plus, an area expert helps you plan an itinerary out before you start driving.

image.alt: Self Guided Backcountry Jeep Adventure

item.title: Exciting and Scenic Off-Road Guided Tour of Moab's Backcountry!!!
item.description: Explore the off-road trails around Moab the easy way on this day-time or sunset guided tour. Avoid getting lost off track when you travel with a knowledgeable guide. Be amazed by the rocky desert landscape and reach places that would be hard to get to without a four-wheel drive. This is a private tour just for you and your party.

image.alt: Exciting and Scenic Off-Road Guided Tour of Moab's Backcountry!!!

item.title: U-Drive Hells Revenge 4x4 Tour- 2.5 HR TOUR
item.description: Take an off-road adventure on the Hell's Revenge slick rock trail with this u-drive adventure. Your guide will get you familiar and comfortable with off-road driving before taking you out to the trail, where you and up to three additional passengers can explore. A more mellow alternative is also available with advance request.

image.alt: U-Drive Hells Revenge 4x4 Tour- 2.5 HR TOUR

item.title: Canyonlands National Park Needles District by 4x4
item.description: Hit the dusty trail on a 4x4 tour of Canyonlands National Park. Expert guides will take you to see the highlights of Utah’s Chesler Park such as Elephant Hill, Devil’s Lane, and Devil’s Kitchen. There’s also the option to take a 3-mile (4.8-km) hike on the spectacularly scenic Joint Trail. This full-day adventure is the perfect way to experience Utah’s backcountry away from the crowds.

image.alt: Canyonlands National Park Needles District by 4x4

item.title: Whitewater Rafting on the Colorado River
item.description: Adventurous travelers looking for a fun but not-too-extreme adventure will love this white-water rafting tour on the Colorado River. You'll be paddling through relatively small class II rapids, which is ideal for first-time rafters. Admire the amazing canyons and cliffs as you drift along calm sections, then paddle hard and be prepared to get wet as you ride the rapids.

image.alt: Whitewater Rafting on the Colorado River

item.title: Discover Best Of Moab In A Day: Arches, Canyonlands, Dead Horse
item.description:
[THREE TOUR OPTIONS AVAILABLE] Not all Moab tours are equal and this tour stands out as the most comprehensive tour of Moab's 3 parks. Peer out through the towering walls of Park Avenue, stand inside the cathedral-like Double Arch, and experience the awe of exploring inside a slot canyon at Sand Dune Arch. Then in the afternoon, lose yourself in the endlessness of the vast Dead Horse Pt and Canyonlands vistas on this well-paced, delightfully revealing tour. Travel in a small group, and out of the sun and dust in a comfortable, closed, air-conditioned vehicle and make many stops for fabulous photos. This non-bumpy, highly interactive tour takes you back in deep time (millions of years) to decipher the park's mysterious landscape of fins and arches, delicate ecology and botany of the desert and the rich cultural heritage of the area.
***Please note that we do not sell our products directly on "Cool Destinations". Our tour prices include taxes.***

image.alt: Discover Best Of Moab In A Day: Arches, Canyonlands, Dead Horse

item.title: Arches National Park Scenic Tours From Moab
item.description: Marvel at the highlights of Arches National Park in just hours without getting footsore with this unique scenic van tour from Moab. Savor unobstructed views of this protected land from the glass-enclosed van—which converts to an open-top, weather permitting—and break up the ride with several short, easy walks to iconic scenic overlooks. Learn about the park’s landscape and ecosystem from your guide as you explore by van and on foot.

image.alt: Arches National Park Scenic Tours From Moab

item.title: Canyonlands National Park White Rim Trail by 4WD
item.description: Go off-roading by 4-wheel drive (4WD) deep into Canyonlands National Park via the White Rim Road, a scenic route of switchbacks and red rock formations. This full-day tour with an expert guide includes popular spots such as Island in the Sky, Gooseneck overlook, Musselman Arch, Lathrop Canyon and the Shafer Trail leading to the Colorado River. Take short optional guided hikes that lead to hidden passages, secret canyons and the caves of Canyonlands. Buffet lunch and round-trip transport from Moab included.

image.alt: Canyonlands National Park White Rim Trail by 4WD

item.title: Moab Combo: Colorado River Rafting and Canyonlands 4X4 Tour
item.description: This outdoor adventure combo from Moab takes you off-roading through Canyonlands National Park, followed by a guided rafting trip on the Colorado River. Your guide introduces you to the scenic natural wonders of Canyonlands' Island in the Sky by 4-wheel drive (4WD), including sections of the Shafer Trail and White Rim Road. Enjoy a buffet lunch before an afternoon rafting the white-water rapids of the mighty river. Admire deep canyons, ancient rock art, fossils and natural stone arches on this day trip, great for all ages.

image.alt: Moab Combo: Colorado River Rafting and Canyonlands 4X4 Tour

item.title: Off-Road Private Jeep Adventure in Moab Utah
item.description: Enjoy an adventurous, thrill-seeking way to discover Utah's red rocks and rugged terrain on this private, off-road Jeep tour from Moab. Pick from several daily start times, meet at your local accommodation, and hop aboard. Off-roading lets you explore parts of the region that are off-limits to other vehicles: drive up steep inclines, stop at scenic overlooks, and glimpse the edges of Arches National Park and the Colorado River.

image.alt: Off-Road Private Jeep Adventure in Moab Utah

item.title: Arches and Canyonlands 4X4 Adventure from Moab
item.description: Book this small group tour for an adventure 4x4 driving through Arches and Canyonlands from Moab. You’ll get to go places other vehicles can’t reach with this tour, and you’ll also be keeping costs down by sharing your experience with a small group. Enjoy a provided lunch and ice water along the way to keep you cooled down and energized.

image.alt: Arches and Canyonlands 4X4 Adventure from Moab

item.title: Full-Day Colorado River Rafting Tour at Fisher Towers
item.description: Ride the rapids on one of the Colorado River's most scenic sections on a full-day whitewater rafting tour of Fisher Towers from Moab. Grab a paddle to navigate class I and II rapids if you like, or just sit back and enjoy the scenery featured in many western films while a river guide does all the work. Learn about the river’s geology and ancient history along the way, and break for lunch at a secluded beach during this classic Utah adventure.

image.alt: Full-Day Colorado River Rafting Tour at Fisher Towers
